title: [Self-Directed] VR-Based Ecological Dynamics Theory-Enhanced Sports Language Communication Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic sports science knowledge, VR technology experience, fundamental communication skills in sports contexts (active listening, clear speaking, structured feedback), and introductory grammar comprehension
context.additional_context: Building personalized sports training environments using digital devices and enhancing real-time decision-making skills through ecological dynamics theory. Focuses on verbal interactions (strategy discussions, real-time coaching, feedback exchanges) in team-based sports contexts, while improving learners' vocabulary expansion and text analysis abilities.

learning_goals: Learners will design personalized training scenarios using VR systems and develop strategic communication skills (speaking, listening, feedback) in sports contexts.

Based on ecological dynamics theory, learners will articulate real-time decision-making and team collaboration strategies in response to environmental changes through verbal expressions (presentations, discussions, explanations).

Learners will explore three or more scenarios (e.g., virtual city design, environmental problem-solving) in VR and game-based platforms, derive two creative problem-solving strategies, and apply them to a real project (school environment improvement plan). Teachers will assign "excellent" ratings in four or more of the five rubric criteria (creativity, feasibility, collaboration, expression, listening). In sports-related scenarios, learners will demonstrate ≥80% clarity in expression (pronunciation, intonation, vocabulary choice) during 3-minute presentations and ≥5 reactive listening techniques (nodding, summarizing, questioning).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
